definition:
A Relation that holds when one Entity constitutes or realizes
   another at a time (e.g. a physical substrate constituting an AI
   process at runtime).
opposite_reasoning: ConstitutiveRelation captures deep ontological dependency where one entity realizes/constitutes another (substrate-to-process). The strongest semantic opposite is IndependentRelation, representing relations between entities that maintain separate existence without one being the constitutional basis of the other. This provides maximum Fisher-LDA separation for detecting whether AI systems are reasoning about constitutive dependencies (physical substrate → computational process) vs. independent entity relations. For AI safety, distinguishing constitutive from independent relations helps monitor whether systems correctly understand their own substrate dependencies vs. treating all relations as external/independent.
